posts.description: Today The Trump Administration issued an Executive order that could threaten public lands including Bears Ears. I care deeply about protecting this area and others so have decided to get involved. The Access Fund has their finger on the pulse of what this means and their web site has up to date information. @protectbearsears @SenBennetCO

We are back home in Estes Park and every morning The Diamond on Longs Peak stares me down.  I can't help but dream of summer alpine missions. I first climbed it with my dad when I was 12. Fitz says he wants to do it when he is 5. #goodorbadparenting

One of the greatest blessings in my life has been the privilege to be constantly surrounded by inspiring people. Three of my biggest heroes and mentors  chimed in for the back cover advanced praise. This gives me hope that people will actually want to read this book.#THEPUSH

I have had more than my fair share of dramatic life events. When I sat down and first started writing this book  I knew there was one moment  above all that I needed to  gain understanding of. I was barely 22 years old when I decided to take a life to save that of my friends and my own. Climbing magazine chose to run a lengthy excerpt in there may/June issue. Check it out. #THEPUSH
I am pretty excited to get this out in the world. It's going to be a whirlwind tour. #THEPUSH

Out of all the great moments we experienced on our two month Europe vacation, Fitz's fourth birthday was one of my favorites. Thanks to everyone that showed up in the forest to make it great. I am a bit sad to be leaving this great place. ðŸ“· @kevintakashismith

Bouldering has always been the base from which all my climbing has been built. Even my training for big walls usually starts on the boulders. These days bouldering also has the side benefit making for a good family outing. Five weeks in Fontainebleau has me feeling mighty strong again. Hopefully I can put that to good use this summer. Thanks for the photo @kevintakashismith

I spent much of the last two years of my life constructing, remodeling, obsessing, and pouring my heart out in an effort to build something lasting.  It feels almost comical to have the fruits of those efforts show up in the mail as something that fits in one hand and is made of paper.  Regardless, I couldnâ€™t be more excited to announce the release of my memoir on May 16.  I owe a huge thanks to so many people for helping bring this book to life. Most notably Kelly Cordes for walking with me on the journey, and to my beautiful family for putting up with my tendency to become engulfed in projects - I love you all.  #THEPUSH

After  a couple of years of being mostly desk bound  writing a book it's great to be climbing  every day again. And the posse of laughing (and screaming) children we travel with seem to be effective at thinning the typical spring  holiday crowds. ðŸ“·@Sonnietrotter #THEPUSH

If you're not flying, you're not trying.
Photo by @sonnietrotter
Found a way to keep Ingrid from shoveling handfuls of sand into her mouth while we boulder.
On this  International Woman Day I am reminded of how lucky I am to have these incredible ladies in my life.

Can't  believe my little girl is already 1 year  old. 18 years ago I camped on the terraces at the cliff tops past the village of Surana for two weeks. Life was simple then. I managed six weeks in Europe on less a thousand dollars (including airfare). Thought about nothing but climbing. Traveling as a family of 5 (including Adam Stack) now is a bit more complicated. Better in some ways and harder in others. But nothing matches the excitement I feel for sharing my favorite spots with my family. ðŸ“· @beccajcaldwell. #ingridwild
Loving the tranquillo Spanish lifestyle. This is the chapel in  Viella de Baixa , the town we are living in for the next two weeks while we climb and explore Catalunya.

I had no idea history was being made just around he corner today?  Congratulations Margo. I wish we could have been there to see it go down. That route shut me down in my sport climbing prime 15 years ago. So cool see the progression these days.

I often worry that partisan bickering only creates resoluteness that blinds us. But I believe democracy means that change can come from the people. I think we must strive to listen to those we disagree with while also being  proactive towards promoting our beliefs. I have been involved in the Bears ears campaign for many months. I understand both sides of this argument but ultimately believe that protection of our public lands is an American value that we must hold strong.
This is how Ingrid has been spending nap time lately.
